alert.note: Alert for Calumet; Manitowoc (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GreenBay (East Central Wisconsin - Green Bay)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 13 at 7:59PM CDT by NWS GreenBay
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Calumet and Manitowoc Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 758 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Valders, or 13 miles west of Manitowoc, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, torrential downpours. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Ponding of water on roadways is possible. Locations impacted include... Manitowoc, Chilton, Brillion, Valders, St. Nazianz, High Cliff State Park, Northern Lake Winnebago, Central Lake Winnebago, Two Rivers and Harrison. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
